newsitem.title: USA: AlliedSignal expects 15-17 pct yr growth.
newsitem.headline: AlliedSignal expects 15-17 pct yr growth.

text.p: AlliedSignal Inc Chief Executive Larry Bossidy said Wednesday that the company expects current fiscal year earnings growth between 15 percent and 17 percent.
Earlier this year, the company had been projecting growth in the range of between 13 percent and 17 percent. The latest projection increases the lower range of possible growth.
While last year's results were driven largely by its materials business, this year's gains have been fueled by the aerospace unit, Bossidy said in a telephone interview.
"We are enthused because our revenues continue to grow," he said.
"We think this year (earnings growth) will be close to 15 to 17 percent."
That prediction comes as the company matched First Call earnings estimates for the third quarter of $0.90 per share.

The company reported its third quarter results Wednesday, of net of $253 million, or $0.90 per share, compared with $217 million, or $0.77 per share, in the same period the prior year. The results represent a 17 percent increase in earnings.

Sales in the aerospace area increased 12 percent to $1.45 billion compared with $1.289 billion during the 1995 third quarter. Sales in its engineered materials division were up nine percent to $1.01 billion compared with $918 million in the same period the prior year.
Bossidy said he was confident of improved results in the automotive area since the company shed its braking business in April.

The third quarter's results seemed to underscore that optimism. Including the braking business, automotive sales dropped 31 percent to $891 million compared with $1.29 billion in the prior year's third quarter. Excluding the braking business, the company's automotive sales increased five percent, AlliedSignal said.
The sale, Bossidy said, "takes away a business that we were having some difficulty with. It leaves us in a better position."
"Our automotive business is coming back nicely," he added. "We don't see any significant drags" from other segments, he said.
The company ended the 1995 fiscal year with net income of $875 million, or $3.09 per share, compared with net income of $759 million, or $2.68 per share for the 1994 fiscal year.
AlliedSignal manufactures aerospace and automotive products, chemicals, fibers, plastics and advanced materials.
